abstract: Big banks that can cut costs by 2 percent while adding revenue and avoiding fines could achieve a combined 12 percent return on equity by 2017, a calculation shows.
snippet: Big banks that can cut costs by 2 percent while adding revenue and avoiding fines could achieve a combined 12 percent return on equity by 2017, a calculation shows.
lead_paragraph: Investor redemption may be nearing for investment banks. Most lenders’ wholesale units have destroyed value for seven years. Some may have done so again in the first quarter of this year.

headline.main: Investment Banks Are Within Reach of Adequate Returns
